result.execSummary:
The defendant James Earl Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Probation/Parole Agents, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2m)(b).
  • Battery to Probation/Parole Agents, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Counts 1 and 2 concurrent with each other and concurrent with any sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Earl Bennett

records.addlTxt: 9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Earl Bennett in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for James Earl Bennett. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 and 2. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 2 years prison and 2 years extended supervision on each count concurrent with each other and concurrent with any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program or Challenge Incarceration Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 80 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity: Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:09 PM Defendant James Earl Bennett in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video. Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.

Activity: Preliminary Hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:04 PM Defendant James Earl Bennett in court, in custody appearing by video with attorney Walter Isaacson also appearing by video.  David Zarwell   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Cash bond set of $100,000.00   with conditions, No contact directly or indirectly with victim SEM or CD, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. If released defendant to remain in his residence 24 hours a day unless at work or traveling to or from work. Absolute sobriety.   May not possess any weapons. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. matter continued to allow time for defendants attorney to be present. Adjourned initial appearance May 5, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
